item.title: Report X-2023050542
item.description:
Report X-2023050542

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T21:09:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A used gasoline powered lawn mower was being returned with gasoline in its tank. A strong smell of gasoline prompted personnel to remove the pkg from system flow. Pkg was sent to QA where it was later taken to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Spilled gasoline was found outside the fuel tank as well as several ounces of gasoline still in the fuel tank which leaked due to a loose gas cap. Released liquid appears to have been contained to the contents of and the inner packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed upright on an open cart as there is no way to secure it in a salvage drum/container.

item.title: Report X-2023050451
item.description:
Report X-2023050451

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T21:09:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Lawn mower with gas and oil still in the machine was shipped improperly. Pkg was transported in a manner that allowed it to leak due to no orientation arrows. Too much weight for the pkg caused the carton to rip as well. DescribePack: Gasoline leaked from the fuel cap and oil leaked from the crankcase through the carburetor wetting and contaminating the contents and carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg with contents sideways was placed on a rolling cart and staged by an open dock door until authorized and properly trained personnel could investigate, inspect and report the incident.

  • City: WILLINGTON

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found with the top and side of the box wet. The package was put in a lined hazmat tote in the upright position and sent to QA. DescribePack: When the box was opened up and inspected it was found that 1 X 1 gallon bottle of formula 83 had leaked in the box. The seal under the cap was broken. The whole top of the box is wet from the leaking formula 83. The duration of release was about a minute. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The box was put in the upright position in a lined hazmat tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was leaked on by another damaged package. When the box was found it was put into a lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. The caps were removed, and it was found that the seal under the caps were broken. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The box when found was put in the upright position and put into a lined hazmat tote. The duration of release was less then 1 minute.

item.description:
Report X-2023041123

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T21:09:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-20
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was damaged at the delivery terminal. None of the required documents were filed by the terminal where the damage occurred. Pkg was placed in an unlined salvage drum and sent to the terminals secondary Hub where evaluation of the container determined the gross failure of required reporting procedures. DescribePack: Wet pkg in unlined salvage drum contains 2 x 1 gal plastic bottles. Cap missing and inner seal ripped/torn which allowed the liquid contents to leak in to a small wastepaper basket that the pkg was placed into inside of the 20 gal. salvage drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed in the unlined salvage drum. Upon discovery of the negligent packing procedures the pkg was placed in a properly lined salvage drum to await disposition and disposal by authorized Hazardous Waste vendor.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The pkg was being unloaded when an unloader found the pkg to be wet. Management was immediately notified and the unloader was removed from the work area. The damaged pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin and taken to the Hazmat Processing Area. The Hazmat hotline was contacted and advised that the affected personnel should be treated in accordance with the guidelines of the ERG related to the chemical in the pkg. No first aid needed to be rendered but the injury report was filed for package handler James Cutler. DescribePack: A loose that was almost completely off was found which allowed liquid to leak as the pkg was transported. The packing material and packaging were found wet on the side and bottom of the bottle and carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin.

  • Description: On December 15, 2022, Moran Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that seven (7) gallon of material was released. Moran Environmental personnel neutralized the impacted area and used granular absorbents to collect the material. The spent absorbents, debris, and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste containers were transported offsite by Moran Environmental personnel to process for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: At 1134 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XHR. It was reported that approximately 7 ounces of UN1789 HCL NF 6.0N released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to damage caused during transit. The release impacted the inside of trailer #622444. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged jug was collected into a 30-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area and collected along with the damaged pallet into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2022091075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T21:09:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-02
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg appears to have leaked at another facility. Bottom of pkg was retaped after the contents were placed in a FedEx Ground Hazmat bag/liner. Pkg was forwarded to the next load point where it was removed from system flow due to the carton being wet. The pkg was placed in an improperly lined non Hazmat tote and taken to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and damage reporting. DescribePack: Loose caps on 4 x 1 gal plastic bottles allowed liquid to leak from the bottles through the unsecured Hazmat bag/liner wetting the improperly handled damaged Hazmat pkg. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Initially the contents were repacked in a FedEx Ground Hazmat bag/liner. Upon discovery at this location the pkg was placed in an improperly lined non Hazmat plastic tote.

item.description:
Report X-2022090563

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-28T21:09:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-23
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Inner pkg was damaged at the destination then placed in an unmarked salvage drum and sent to the wrong Hub for evaluation/disposal. Inspection at time of discovery found the lock ring of the salvage container was on upside down, no hazmat markings on the salvage drum, no orientation arrows on the salvage drum and the required Hazmat reports and Safety Data Sheet was not provided. DescribePack: There is a 1/4" cut/hole on the bottom edge of the 1 x 5 gal container which allowed liquid to leak when placed upright in the salvage drum. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Initial discovery location placed the container with a hole on the bottom upright in the salvage drum which allowed it to continue leaking. Upon discovery at this location the container was removed from the salvage drum, ensured cap was tight and secure before turning the damaged pkg upside down to mitigate the release. Pkg was placed in a new lined Hazmat salvage drum to await disposition and prepare for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon arrival it was noticed that the pkg had leaked. Pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat tote and transported on a low level slow moving conveyor to the QA Dept. where it was removed from the belt. After several minutes I was notified of the damaged pkg and that personnel were in the process of cleaning the trailer and damaged pkgs. I transported the pkg and three other affected pkgs to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and damage reporting. DescribePack: One x 2.5 liter plastic bottle of Sulfuric Acid has a loose cap which allowed liquid to leak from the bottle as the pkg had been loaded on its end. The liquid dissolved the end panel and several other pkgs during transit. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: The leaking pkg and three other affected pkgs were placed in lined Hazmat two totes.
